algorithms.name: Subsequence kernel
algorithms.reference: Lodhi, Saunders, Shawe-Taylor, Cristianini, and Watkins. Text classification using string kernels. Journal of Machine Learning Research, 2:419-444, 2002

algorithms.name: Damerau-Levenshtein distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Damerau. A technique for computer detection and correction of spelling errors, Communications of the ACM, 7(3):171-176, 1964

algorithms.name: Lee distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Lee. Some properties of nonbinary error-correcting codes. IRE Transactions on Information Theory 4 (2): 77-82, 1958

algorithms.name: Levenshtein distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Levenshtein. Binary codes capable of correcting deletions, insertions, and reversals. Doklady Akademii Nauk SSSR, 163 (4):845-848, 1966

algorithms.name: Compression distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Cilibrasi and Vitanyi. Clustering by compression, IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, 51:4, 1523-1545, 2005

algorithms.name: Hamming distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Hamming. Error-detecting and error-correcting codes. Bell System Technical Journal, 29(2):147-160, 1950

algorithms.name: Kernel-based distance
algorithms.reference: This module implements a kernel-based distance. A given kernel algorithm is mapped to a Euclidean distance using simple geometry

algorithms.name: Jaro-Winkler distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Jaro. Advances in record linkage methodology as applied to the 1985 census of Tampa Florida. Journal of the American Statistical Association 84 (406): 414-420, 1989. Winkler. String Comparator Metrics and Enhanced Decision Rules in the Fellegi-Sunter Model of Record Linkage. Proceedings of the Section on Survey Research Methods. 354-359, 1990

algorithms.name: Optimal sequence alignment (OSA) distance
algorithms.reference: Doolittle. Of Urfs and Orfs: A Primer on How to Analyze Derived Amino Acid Sequences. University Science Books, 1986

algorithms.name: Weighted-degree kernel
algorithms.reference: Sonnenburg, Raetsch, and Rieck. Large scale learning with string kernels. In Large Scale Kernel Machines, pages 73--103. MIT Press, 2007

algorithms.name: Spectrum kernel
algorithms.reference: C. Leslie, E. Eskin, and W. Noble. The spectrum kernel: a string kernel for SVM protein classifica- tion.  In Proc. of Pacific Symposium on Biocomputing (PSB), pages 564-575, 2002

algorithms.name: Bag distance for strings
algorithms.reference: Bartolini, Ciaccia, Patella. String Matching with Metric Trees Using an Approximate Distance.  String Processing and Information Retrieval, LNCS 2476, 271-283, 2002
